intro: Digitaria sanguinalis var. debilis, commonly known as slender digitgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as fields and roadsides. The plant has slender, tufted stems and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and often have a bluish-gray hue due to a dense covering of hairs. It is native to temperate regions of the Americas and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
